answers.explanation:
![](/content/media/optic-pit-maculopathy-labelled-.webp)

The abnormalities on the OCT are:

1. Subretinal fluid (blue star)​
2. Intra-retinal cysts (yellow arrow)
3. Retinoschisis (red diamond)

questions.title: Question 1
questions.text:
Given the decline in vision, an OCT macula OS was performed below:

![](/content/media/retina-9-2.webp)

What pathology is NOT present in the OCT shown to the left?

answers.explanation: The Diagnosis is Optic Pit Maculopathy.

title: Case 9
description: 5M presenting with 3-months of worsening vision OS
patientPresentation:
A 5-year-old male presents with a 3-month history of gradually worsening vision in his left eye. Vision was 20/25 OD and 20/200 OS. There was no RAPD. The patient denied any recent history of ocular trauma and is otherwise healthy. There was a vague maternal family history of retinal detachment. The patient's fundus photograph is shown below:
​

![](/content/media/retina-9-1.webp)
